labels.analysis: The MCP Server acts as a bridge between AI assistants and existing automation workflows (referred to as "Integrator automation workflows"). Its core functionality is to enable AI systems to invoke and interact with these workflows, creating a bidirectional communication channel. This allows AI to leverage complex automation logic while simplifying the integration process through parameter descriptions and structured JSON outputs. The available tool ("Optional Settings") suggests user management features for accessing the server.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Integration Automation" reflects the server's core role of connecting AI systems with automation workflows. The secondary label "API Integration" is included because the server exposes structured JSON outputs, implying an API-like interface. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Integrator Automation Server
server_info_crawled.author: @boostspace/integrator-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI assistants to invoke and interact with your Integrator automation workflows as callable tools. Seamlessly connect your existing automation scenarios with AI systems to create bidirectional communication and leverage complex automation logic. Simplify AI integration by exposing your Integrator scenarios with meaningful parameter descriptions and structured JSON outputs.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@boostspace/integrator-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
